description.narrative: Oxfam in Lebanon will work with its partner Nabad to transition WASH activities (Water, Sanitation and Hygiene). This includes de-sludging, water trucking, construction and public health promotion activities. The intention is to give partner Nabad more implementation capacity through a phased approach. The activities themselves are mostly funded through other sources (appeal funds), and thisadditional contribution is mainly used for capacity building and smooth handover of assets and responsibilities. During part of theyear, the humanitarian project officers of Oxfam and Nabad will work side by side to ensure a smooth and proper handover. The activities are implemented in Bekaa Valley.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam has been working in Lebanon since 2006; it has a regional Gender Justice Hub that administers a regional gender justice programme and a Lebanon programme that focuses on three thematic areas of work: Humanitarian, Economic Justice, and Active Citizenship <(>&<)> Governance. Over the course of the past three years, Oxfam in Lebanon has integrated its humanitarian and development programming into a #one programme approach#, as described in the Oxfam Country Strategy. The humanitarian component of the strategy looks atthe continuation of life-saving WaSH service provision, protection services and cash assistance, while in parallel the development programs, in collaboration with local authorities and civil society, aim to address the underlying root causes of inequality and poverty over the longer-term, including through policy change. Our vision is that, by the end of 2021, marginalized women and men (Lebanese, Palestinian and Syrian populations including refugees) are protected and empowered to enjoy their basic rights, enabling them to live in dignity within a more equitable society. Oxfam in Lebanon has a main office in Beirut, and two operational offices in Zahle (Bekaa governance) and Tripoli (North governance).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
